alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 04 at 1:52AM MST until December 06 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and some blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulation 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts on west facing slopes and ridges. Lower amounts on the eastern side of the mountains. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...Beginning 9 PM this evening and continuing through Monday night. * IMPACTS...Falling and blowing snow could significantly reduce visibilities. Hikers and snowmobilers may easily become disoriented.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow and blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to a combination of falling and blowing snow. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas.
